title: Moorestown (computing platform)
text:
Moorestown is the <a href="Intel%20Corporation">Intel Corporation</a>'s handheld <a href="Mobile%20Internet%20device">MID</a> and smartphone platform based on Lincroft <a href="system-on-a-chip">system-on-a-chip</a> with an <a href="Intel%20Atom">Atom processor</a> core, Langwell input/output Platform Controller Hub (I/O PCH), and a Briertown Power Management IC. Announced in 2010, the platform was demonstrated running <a href="Moblin%20Linux">Moblin Linux</a>.
The Moorestown platform introduced the Simple Firmware Interface (SFI), a lightweight alternative to ACPI. In Linux 5.12, support for SFI, which was previously marked as obsolete, was removed from the kernel by Intel.
